website_summaries.verdict: This is a simple slow-eating bowl that can effectively eliminate choking for a fast-eating dog.
pros: A good bowl for a smaller dog
A good bowl for a dog on a diet
Slows down eating and makes the food last longer
Dogs really work hard to get the food out of this bowl
cons: The non-slip function of this bowl sometimes does not work very well

customer_reviews.title: Slows my pup down significantly!
customer_reviews.text: The bowl is a nice size and made of nice solid plastic. It also has four rubber feet underneath to keep it for sleeping. I got another one in blue for water and that's working as well. Overall, extremely satisfied since my pup ate so fast he got bloated/reflux. I have attached a video so you can see it in action! If this helps then do make sure to click the helpful button!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Slows down a fast eater
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this dog bowl. Our puppy is 10 months old and eats 1.5 cups of food at each meal. Before he was eating out of a standard bowl, would finish in about 30 seconds, and then go steal food from our other dog’s bowl while she was still eating. Now he is the last one finished. I also like that it provides some mental stimulation. The only negative is that even with the little “grips” on the bottom, it slides on the floor. I think we may put a rubber mat underneath to prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was very sceptical about this as last night was the first time I used it, I have a Rottweiler and she is a super fast ester, she will choke, spit her food out, and try to eat the other dogs food when she is done with hers, the first time she used this she still ate prettt quick, this morning I just fed her and she is still eating, while my older dog is done , which never happens, so I am really glad I got this, it works amazingly
customer_reviews.author: Brittany neff

customer_reviews.title: Cute but needs work!
customer_reviews.text: The bowl is cute but the 4 little rubber bits on the bottom to hold it in place are a joke. My dish was delivered with one missing and the other 3 are not securely attached. UPDATE: as of 3/15/2017 JasGood contacted me immediately and has corrected the issues to my satisfaction. Thank you...would buy from you again with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: Our fat beagle Gus would inhale his food and then try and kick his room mate Harvey out of the kitchen and then eat his food as well hence why he is fat. We needed to desperately slow his eating down so that Harvey could have a chance to eat in peace. Well this bowl did the trick even better than we anticipated. Harvey now has plenty of time to eat his food in peace and then go lay on the couch even before Gus is half way through his meal. Highly recommended for very fast eaters. Now if I can only figure out a way to slow my son down at dinner, any thoughts?
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Slows my dog's drinking to an acceptable slurp
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a 13-year old Chihuahua mix. Before I got him, he had 10 teeth removed and was neutered. He was under anesthetic for quite a while and developed esophagitis, which means he has trouble swallowing. The poor little guy rarely drinks water and many times, he upchucks it almost immediately. I tried other bowls I had, but they didn't help enough. Although he still has issues occasionally, this bowl has helped tremendously. If your dog eats or drinks fast, I recommend this bowl.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.B

customer_reviews.title: The dish is bigger than what it looks like in the picture
customer_reviews.text: My hungry Beagle was eating too quickly. Now he takes a breath between bites. The dish is bigger than what it looks like in the picture. I put a half cup of kibble in each feeding. The only negative is that it has little grips that you insert on the bottom, and they fall out. I don't think they're needed, and it's not a big deal. My Beagle hasn't minded this new dish at all, and it works like it should.
customer_reviews.author: P. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: No more bloat!!
customer_reviews.text: My puppies eat so quickly that one had really bad bloat. These bowls slow down their eating a lot, and I'm no longer worried about bloat all the time. Being plastic, I do have to wash them more often than the metal bowls; the plastic kind of attracts dirt. Overall, I'm very happy with these dog bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jean

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This bowl did the trick. My 5 month old Aussie was eating so fast, he’d make himself sick. This really slows him down. Also, his poo had been soft for a month. Nothing I tried helped that problem. The first day of him eating slower, his poo returned to normal. This was an unexpected added benefit. To clean I dunk it in soapy waster with a bit of bleach. This bowl doesn’t slide all over the place, either, like the stainless steel one I bought to try out. My pup eats just over a cup of food at a time. I think you could put up to a cup and a half in this easily.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Only for very small dogs
customer_reviews.text: It may work for a small dog but it doesn’t work well for a large breed. I have a 11 week old German Shepherd and she pushes it all around the house because the gaps are too small for her to get food, the non-skids are a joke and the bowl is extremely light. The inner diameter of the bowl is less than 6 1/2 inches and the depth is 1.25”. It only holds about two cups of kibble. My puppy chewed it up the edges on the first feeding. It did slow her eating down but mostly because the gaps are too small and she pushed the bowl around the house because she couldn’t reach her food.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Perron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set
customer_reviews.text: The first set I purchased the pink bowl was cracked. I let Amazon know and they sent out a replacement the next business day. I love these bowls. Our chihuahuas are 7lbs & 4lbs and these bowls are a great size to spread their food around. Our black & tan chi likes to scarf her food down and these bowls have helped her to eat a bit slower. I thought they were going to be a thin cheap plastic but they surprised me and are pretty thick. I am a pleased dog mom 🐶🐾
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lorraine Designs

customer_reviews.title: YES!! Love this! Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect thing for a dog who eats too fast. My dog would eat her whole bowl of food in less than one minute and she's small, which was so confusing. This makes her work for her food and seems to actually excite her since it presents a challenge she has to solve. Now her eating time is closer to 10-15 mins. Love this product and would highly recommend for all those dogs that inhale their food. haha. The bowl my seem large, but I have a small dachshund (wiener dog) who eats like a great dane. This may not be big enough for large dogs but this size is definitely great for small and medium dogs.
customer_reviews.author: alyzee

customer_reviews.title: Slows them down
customer_reviews.text: Had this about a week now. My puppy was eating her food so quick she was coughing and choking on food. I bought the slow feeder off a recommendation and she actually chews her food now thankfully. No more choking or coughing. The bowl holds a good amount of food and its easy to wash. Im buying a spare just in case because she eats so much better out of this. If you have a fast eater, don't hesitate to buy. Its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: MB121

customer_reviews.title: This bowl works great!
customer_reviews.text: My dog Finnegan is a fast eater. It must have been when he and his sister, Valentina lived with their three other siblings as well as five other dogs. I bet he had to eat fast! I adopted both Finnegan and Valentina a few months ago. They are five years old. (The family could not take care of the 9 dogs anymore.) Valentina would always eat at a normal pace and when Finnegan was finished eating, he was be hawking at Valentina's bowl. Now, with this new bowl, Finnegan is last to finish and all is well. (Valentina has manners.) I think Finnegan's digestion is better as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-David

customer_reviews.title: The idea is good
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good but the bowl is absolutely to light. My two Beagles both got discouraged and just used their paws to tip over the bowl and dump the food all over the floor. I bought three different designs, 2 for my dogs and one for my son's dog. All 3 dogs did the same thing. If you just use it for in-between meals with a small amount of food it should be ok but not on carpet since it will slide. If there is a way to put weight on bottom this would work great.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D

customer_reviews.title: Does what its suppose to do.
customer_reviews.text: I just got it and it does the job, slows her waaaaay down. She usually inhales her food without chewing so she finishes in about 10 seconds. It takes her at least a minute now to finish the bowl and she get about half a cup of food. Only thing is it slides around, I tried to put it in the corner but I'll probably just put a textured mat under it. Overall I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Works for cats
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat. She has to pick the kibbles out individually with her paws and eat them off the floor, which slows her down and helps pace her food intake. Although she hasn't flipped it yet, the downside is that she drags the bowl all over the kitchen in the process. This got 4 stars instead of 5 because there are four rubberized feet that are supposed to keep it in place. Not only do they not work, but they constantly fall out and I'm worried that my cat will try to eat one and choke on it. I will probably just throw them out at some point.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: My schnauzer is a bit overweight lol so I bought her this is hopes that’s she’d eat slower. So far I like the product. She didn’t like it at first because it forced her to eat slower and would leave half the food but she’s eating normally now. I like the product the only thing I disliked was that the stoppers on the bottom that are supposed to be for grip, looked like if they were glued on last minute and rushed because when it arrived the bowl was all sticky. It still is even after I washed it but it still works. I took a pic but it doesn’t give me the option to upload it?
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs something underneath to hold in place
customer_reviews.text: Great product intended to slow your puppy’s eating! This video is our Labrador puppy’s first time using it. I could tell it presented mental stimulation as he tried to maneuver around to get the kibble. The bowl itself is kindof lightweight so it did shift around a bunch. I had it on a mat with rubber grips, as you can see from the pic. If you just put it on tile or hardwood it’s be pushed all over the place. But overall if you set it up right it’ll serve its purpose!
customer_reviews.author: K. Mulvey-Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: This slowed my dog down dramatically so he no longer gulps all his food and later throws it up un-chewed. He really has to work at getting his food from all the little areas. I've been putting it in the dishwasher every week or two and it is holding up fine so far after a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Vintage Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It works !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that likes to inhale food rather than savor it and then go and eat her brothers food (he’s a really slow eater). This little bowl worked like a charm! She went to drive in and immediately encountered the lil bumps. She stared at it and kept trying to dive in. Finally she realized that if she took her TIME she could get the food out without problem. It’s helped with her weight too. She now gets full with the amount given her instead of eating her bowl so fast she thinks she’s still hungry and goes for her brothers. The key is to not fill the bowl above the nubs. This is a great bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slows down our fast eating dog
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our dog who DEVOURS her food in about 30 seconds or less. There have been times she has thrown up after doing this as well. We all know eating too fast isn't good for you, and that includes our pets. This bowl does in fact slow our dog down when she eats. It takes her about 2-3 minutes now to eat her serving of food. She is able to eat every single kibble in this bowl as well. I highly recommend this bowl if your dog eats WAY too fast. It's confuse them at first, but they'll get the hang of it!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Has reduced to just about none the regurgitation she was experiencing! Excellent idea!
customer_reviews.text: This has tremendously slowed the eating of my Bella. She eats slower and is not getting for food again right away. Also has reduced to just about none the regurgitation she was experiencing from eating too fast! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Jones

customer_reviews.title: Slowed these dogs waaaayyyy down
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 golden retrievers and one puppy. They GOBBLE the food in 4 seconds. I wasnt sure if this would work...I figured it wouldnt really slow down these dogs too much but let me tell you....it takes every single one of them AWHILE to eat their kibbles now. And I can tell they have fun trying to get every last little bite in the plastic maze. Very durable. Slightly hard to clean due to the raised books and crannies but who cares? I havent really bothered to keep up with that since they lick their bowls clean!
customer_reviews.author: tess devin

customer_reviews.title: Slows gobbling up the food!
customer_reviews.text: This dog dish did what I had hoped it would do- slow my pooch down at eating time. She is a sizable Boston Terrier and woofs her dry kibbles like WOOF - instantly. She is not famished and there are no other dogs. With this dish she has to work at getting the food out and can not get mouths fulls at a time. It takes her probably 3x's the time to finish her cup at each feeding. The dish would slide around on bare flooring but I put it on a rug as it has 4 small velcro type strips that seem to hold well. It works for us great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this for our dog, and I was kind of annoyed because I thought we could do other things to stop him from gulping his food down (resulting in his throwing it up occasionally) so quickly. I also thought it was kind of mean since he's on the skinny side and might have to work too hard for his food. Well......I have to admit, not only does this slow him down, but he seems to enjoy the process of eating like never before. I'm sold - this thing WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: jhilllVT

customer_reviews.title: Stopped my dog's burps
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the function of this slow feeder. After each meal, our dog used to lovingly jump into our laps, gaze into our eyes and unleash a shockingly forceful burp for such a little guy. That hasn't happened once since we started using the slow feeder! It's good our dog was burping as that made bloat less likely but we decided to do his digestive tract a solid and give his brain a little workout in the process. He loves his new bowl. I took off a star for the condition the bowl arrived in (see pictures). Damaged, dented and stained. But since it works I didn't feel like bothering to exchange it for another.
customer_reviews.author: Gin Snob

customer_reviews.title: Good bowl for gobble dogs!
customer_reviews.text: We have a yorkie and chihuahua who both eat so fast they barely chew. The bowl was delivered yesterday and both pups circled their respective dinner before actually figuring out there was food. Once they stated eating, what normally would take less than a minute actually took 5 minutes to finish. Pretty pink and blue colors for my boy and girl fur babies. Think this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl G

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Dog from Inhaling her Food!
customer_reviews.text: This is well-made and sturdy and works great for my dog. Only suggestion: Make these with more eco-friendly material though, rather than plastic, which never really breaks down. People are becoming more and more aware of this and like to patronize companies that are environmentally friendly. Great product though!
customer_reviews.author: nwhlranger

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs who inhale their food
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bowl for my 62lb Golden retriever. She is one of those dogs that vacuums her food up with little to no chewing especially when it's a home made meal. This really slows her down when it comes to kibble as well as for when I make her a homemade dinner as a treat. If you're using homemade food or soft food, I'd recommend you use a spoon to fill the bowl in order to make sure it gets into the channels instead of laying on top.
customer_reviews.author: J_schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Too Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bowl bottom is not level and it is very lightweight. My dog put his paw on it to try to hold it in place while he ate. Also, he overturned the bowl and I found one of the four nonskid “feet” had popped out and could have been ingested. As a replacement I. ordered the “Go-Slow” by dog it and the quality and weight is far superior for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebird

customer_reviews.title: Great product and meets the goal
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised that the features provided for rating don't include "achieves purpose" or something to that effect. Why else would you buy a dog bowl like this unless you were trying to slow down your pet's eating experience? This product certainly achieved that objective. Our dog (a beagle) went from wolfing down her food in less than a minute to needing about 3 minutes with the use of this bowl. As a result, we love it! She no longer has occasional bouts of vomiting. It also has the features mentioned above--it's sturdy, easy to clean, and very durable. So we're very happy with it. We haven't asked our beagle's opinion but I'm sure she'd give it a paws up.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S. Bell

customer_reviews.title: It’s not too big for a small dog.
customer_reviews.text: I want to share my review because as a small dog owner, I didn't See this specific topic before I bought this bowl. My dog is a “Min-Pin” rescue. She has the typical rescue eating habit of eating like it’s her last meal and over eating. I thought The bowl was too large for her (she’s 10 lbs). The size of the bowl helps distribute the food better and definitely helps slow her down. I’ve used for dry and moist foods. I’m so glad I didnt Return it thinking it was too big. It’s terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy R Baergen

customer_reviews.title: More suitable for smaller dogs with more narrower snouts
customer_reviews.text: Like: I liked that it came as expected and displayed in the photo. Disliked: I did not anticipate the height of the bowl to be a problem for my Golden retriever/ Golden doodle mix. She is 70 lbs, kind of a big girl. I think it is more suitable for smaller dogs with more narrower snouts. My pupper has to tilt her head a certain ways to get into some spots even then she may need my assistance with the last few kernels. I did keep it, because there was no concerns over quality or durability.
customer_reviews.author: Urantuya Purev-Ochir

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bowl
customer_reviews.text: My dachshund would always eat his food way too fast. More often than not he would throw it all back up again soon after. This bowl has really helped him slow his eating process and it's helped his digestive system to improve. It's not the easiest to clean, but it's manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R. Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This item is perfect. Since we cook my dogs meals She rushes to eat, which leads to lots of burping. I was skeptical of getting it because my dog is a maltese and the bowl is big. As a result the bowl is the perfect size. My dog takes twice as long to finish her meal. The bowl is nice and strong and easy to clean. The price is definitely worth it as well.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Helping a girl lose a few pounds!
customer_reviews.text: My six-year-old dog began to gain weight this year, so we switched her from "grazing" to a twice-daily feeding schedule. She now gobbles her food and I feared she would choke from eating too fast. Seeing the low price offered on Amazon Prime day, I decided it was time to try a "slow feeder" bowl. The bowl came a quick few days later, and it now takes her five minutes, rather than 30 seconds to eat her breakfast and dinner. I'm happy with the size of the bowl and quality of the material.
customer_reviews.author: TTPopsing1978

customer_reviews.title: Worked - sort of, but still love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our new puppy just swallows food down. So we heard to get one of these bowls. I liked the design of this one and it was a good pick. He has slowed down and has to work for his food now. But, he still swallows a lot of it without chewing. Not the bowls fault, but just as an FYI for those with a similar issue. Bowl was still worth it, he has no problem eating, it takes him a little longer and he's not swallowing so much that he's choking. Was worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: N. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Hella satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a bowl my fat dog can't tip over or snarf his way through. He was so upset the first day because the pieces took so long to dislodge(3 seconds is a long wait for this fat boi) and he couldn't paw it over. He left half his breakfast behind the first day and stared at me like i was giving him kale. Now its been a while and he can finish a cup of food in about 8 minutes, which is a good improvement on 0.001 seconds. Id say you could fit 2 cups in at a time but this works fine for us. 1cup for a dachsund/pit mix.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Lane

customer_reviews.title: great for fast eating pets
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 doxies, one eats slow, the other actually sucks her food up and swallows, no chewing. This has slowed her down so much, and now she chews most of the morsels. Freckles will walk around her bowl about 4-5 times, getting to each morsel of food. Now the slow eater finishes first, this bowl slowed Freckles down that much. They have to use their tongue to lift the food out of the bowl which is a challenge, but in a good way.
customer_reviews.author: James McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Bowl!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our new rescue pup who just inhales her food. It definitely slows her down! I love the different levels of obstacles in the bowl, really makes her slow and work for the food. She does push it around the floor quite a bit, so I may invest in a non slip mat for it, since it just glides across the floor during mealtime. Overall love it though! Color is super cute and it holds up to a cup and a half of food without going over the obstacles.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Foil

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs that eat too fast!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bowl set! We got a new rescue dog and she was eating so quickly she would throw up. I got this set as I knew I would need two bowls, one for the new dog and one for my older dog so there wouldn’t be any food stealing. I think the design of the bowls is really good and so far my new dog hasn’t figured out any way to get around eating slowly. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jcourt

customer_reviews.title: Slows him down
customer_reviews.text: We have a 3 month old standard poodle. He would eat so fast he would give himself the hiccups. We were just spreading his food on the floor to slow him down - which we were not fond of doing. This bowl is fantastic. He’s gone from eating in less than a minute to working 3-4 minutes to get every last piece. He’s 4 months now and is up to to 1 3/4 cups per serving and it fits in this bowl. No more hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: aealbin

customer_reviews.title: Good bowls just pay attention to the size.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the size, smaller than expected. It can hold a cup of dry kibble with no problem. It may have stated the size in the description but if so I missed it. Still though, I like the bowls and will keep them. Definitely helped slow down my dogs from gulping down their food in 30 seconds or less and can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The plastic is non harmful
customer_reviews.text: This bowl helps my dog eat a little slower, cause she eats like she starving so now it’s not as fast! I’m looking to buy a bigger bowl like this for my lab cause she does the same thing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected but still does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my chihuahua to slow down when eating and although I ordered a small, this was bigger than I expected. I kept it though and her food spreads out nicely and seems to have worked. She didn’t like it at first but she gave in and now she eats at a normal pace. She doesn’t sound like she’s choking anymore and that’s really all that I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: So, this dish does not help at all with slowing my dog down. It is well built and sturdy, but the channels are not nearly deep enough. For this to be effective, the channels need to be deeper than they are. They only appear to be about an inch or so deep. The food rests almost entirely on top of the channel, even when spreading the food out it does little to nothing in effectively slowing down the dog.
customer_reviews.author: David Iorillo

customer_reviews.title: So Simple
customer_reviews.text: My 45lb dog was throwing up after eating kibble because he was eating too fast. He didn’t need to be majorly slowed down, just a little. Ever since I’ve gotten this bowl my pup has not had any vomiting problems. I also have a slow eating dog who eats out of the same bowl. She is 12 pounds and has no problem with this bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Addie

customer_reviews.title: Fun and effective! Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This has really slowed the pace for how fast both of our dogs eat. It becomes a bit of a game for those last morsels also. It does come clean easy but you'll want to buy a bottle brush or the like to help. Had a couple months now and no chew marks or damage that I can see and again it really slowed down the eating.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: 1 Cup Bowl is small and moves everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the one cup size for my 2 year old English Bulldog. When they say one cup they mean one cup, That fills it to the rim. Then my eager eating Bulldog flings it everywhere. The bowl also just slides everywhere so it is hard to train. He eventually just flips it over and devours the spillage. I ended up screwing it onto a large piece of wood to stop the moving everywhere. The other problem is that my short snouted dog can not get all the food out of the bottom. This bowl might work for a miniature dog or cat but not for a large breed dog. I'm glad it was cheap or I'd be out money.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Thompson

customer_reviews.title: My dog was less anxious after the first use!
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for my dog who would almost inhale his food before. This product has slowed his eating time dramatically and he is less anxious as a result. The bowl is well made and stays in place while he eats. My dog eats 1/3 of a cup per meal, so I thought that the bowl may have been a little large but it turned out to be better than a smaller bowl; the food gets evenly spread so he has to move around the entire inside of the bowl to eat, which also slows down the eating process. I highly recommend this product and wish I knew about this style of feeding bowl before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall, good but SLIDES
customer_reviews.text: My dog eats 3 times slower now. He's a speed eater and normally hacks after inhaling his kibble. Now, with this, he is forced to slowly chew, haha! It works! Only bad thing: the anti-slip on the bottom is faulty. Does NOT work. Bowl slides everywhere.... Oh well, I'm not unhappy :) I recommend if you have a plate that keeps the bowl in place.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: a mixed review
customer_reviews.text: this bowl does what it advertises, and really slows our puppy down in her eating. The problem is, she bites the bowl, and after only a few uses, the edges are totally chewed up and ragged, making them sharp and difficult to get clean, let alone sterile. We will be going to a stainless steel bowl now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I think if I could open my dogs mouth wide enough and just dump a cup of kibble into her mouth, this would be how I would describe that she eats without this slow feeder. She still eats at lightening speed, however she does have to work at it, and it is a great deal slower. Def recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Arrington

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly helpful
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is the best purchase I have made for my pup. She would scarf her food in about 20 seconds. I bought this slow bowl, and now it takes her about 3 minutes. We have been using this bowl for about 2 months, and last week we noticed that our pup will actually leave her food now and go back to it! I LOVE this slow bowl!
customer_reviews.author: Hubert C. Platt, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Helped my dog a lot!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my chihuahua. He used to swallow his whole bowl in seconds and he had gas and belly troubles because of it. We got this and now it takes him much longer, a few minutes at least, to eat. His poops have improved and he no longer has gas problems...which is great bc he’s afraid if his own farts.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it does
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy had a bad habit of gulping down her food within seconds. While eating she made noises like she was nearly choking and then would burp for the next 20 minutes. First use of the bowl and she slowed down and is eating proper. I cant say anything for the durability because its day one, but for the price I'd imagine just buying another if it wore out.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: cleaning it is annoying, but it helps slow down my hobgoblin
customer_reviews.text: my dog, is a glutton. He does not chew, he just swallows his kibble. Enter slow feeder, he is a 14 lb pekepoo and this slows him down a bit. He doesn't pick it up or flip it so that helps me out. My only complaint is how annoying it is to clean and it feels a bit flimsy in comparison to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The puzzles are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These puzzle balls are the best for dogs that eat way too fast. I've owned three of them. They are still lasting for 3 years. This one was for a new puppy. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Madonna52

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a medium sized Boston Terrier Mix. She has a problem with not chewing her food & eating too fast. She would eat so fast she would choke. This bowl stopped it 100%. She was confused at first, but now she can only eat a couple at a time, and it really helped. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Peters

customer_reviews.title: Bulldog eats so fast she passes out
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifesaver. I was having to soak all my dogs food in water for 30 minutes before giving it to her because she would eat so fast she would literally choke and pass out. SCARIEST THING EVER! This bowl makes her slow down and eat her food at a normal pace. I have stained concrete floor and the padding on the bottom helps to bowl not to slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Starr

customer_reviews.title: Good product for some dogs
customer_reviews.text: This slow feeder bowl is very nice and probably would work well for certain dogs, my miniature dachshund has had a slow feeder bowl since I got him as a pup and somehow still managed to scarf his food down in under 30 seconds with this one. Had to split his food into small segments so it took him longer to eat. I do notice less gulping which is a plus. Like I said it is a good product and probably works better with other dogs, my dog is just too persistent with getting every piece of kibble as fast as he can.
customer_reviews.author: cierra Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Help with food bloat and gas
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 small dogs that were getting a lot of bloat and gas by eating their food too fast. We got them these bowls and it had made an awesome difference! They still get "gassy" (lol) sometimes, but the bloat and burping have been completely gone. We now even pack them when going camping
customer_reviews.author: Carmen C

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to slow down my dogs eating. They were woofing down their food so fast it was ridiculous! It really worked. The first day I had to help them finish their food but after the first day they were good with it... now over a month of use they have gotten faster but no way near as fast as they used to be. I think I may need one more now for my third dog who seems to have gotten faster now that the other two have slowed down.
customer_reviews.author: MLM

customer_reviews.title: Works well with two ravenous doggies
customer_reviews.text: We adopted two little overweight senior dogs that came with a strict diet. As a result they are ravenous - talk about a happy dance when it's mealtime. And the one dog will try to eat the other's food so we really needed to slow them down. These feeders work very well in that respect. They are very easy to clean and have held up well. The dogs are in fact slowly losing weight.
customer_reviews.author: willearnest

customer_reviews.title: Works better than we expected!
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 y.o. redbone coon hound would almost literally inhale his food from a regular dish. He is a rescue dog and appears to have some food anxieties. We have another dog, but he has never attempted to go after the younger dog's food, but still, he would eat way to fast (in our opinion). This new dish forces him to take a little more time and work for each kibble. I also think it makes it a bit more of a game. He seems to love it and it has been holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Michaud

customer_reviews.title: No more throw up after wolfing down
customer_reviews.text: These dishes are great. They fit in the dishwasher. They have rubber feet so they don't slide around or make noise like the previous bowls. Our dog takes 3 - 5 minutes instead of 30 seconds to eat. She's stopped throwing up. She's a 55 pound shepherd cross and gets one cup of kibble with about a cup of water or milk twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: Marylinda Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great way to slow your dog down
customer_reviews.text: My GSD is a super fast eater. Now that she is 9.5yo, I worry she could get GD. I feed her three times a day due to her inhaling the food. She recently started vomitting after eating, most likely due to eating too quickly. I bought these bowls and she's slowed down and not had any vomiting since!
customer_reviews.author: C. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Slowed down puppy's eating and we have had no problems with puppy chewing or flipping
customer_reviews.text: We bought this feeder for our 3 month old Labrador Retriever. Our puppy would eat her food in three bites before we bought this feeder. Now she takes her time eating and even leaves some in the bowl if she is full, although it is rare. We have had this product for over two weeks and our puppy has not flipped it over or chewed on it. This is a five star product in our home
customer_reviews.author: Sommer Castor

customer_reviews.title: Great idea to slow your doggo down
customer_reviews.text: It worked to slow down my 6 month old frenchie that was eating like she was in a contest but it could use more or better rubber pads underneath to keep it from sliding on the floor when she's eating. Also, the plastic is very brittle - I dropped it walking to the sink to wash it and a 1 inch chunk from the inner wall fell out of it
customer_reviews.author: Hector O.

customer_reviews.title: Our Carlie loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This was our best buy! Our puppy is growing fast (tripled its weight in 3 weeks), and is an extremely fast eater. She used to take less than a minute eating all of her food - scary to think. Luckily I came across this product. Now she takes about 10 minutes and keeps wagging her tail through the whole thing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lorenapda

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit larger kibble
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this feeder. It seemed great online. I think it's a good design for some dog foods, but my golden retriever is on a prescription vegetarian formula, so his kibble was too large for this bowl. Also, it's much smaller than the other two slow feeders we have, so we couldn't use it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Erin E Donovan

customer_reviews.title: whoa, slow down there pup
customer_reviews.text: seriously slowed down my dog's eating habits, he is still able to eat all of his food, but he also has to work for it a little bit. we add water and we don't have any issues with it
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for dogs that inhale their food!
customer_reviews.text: My Boston terrier inhales his food so decided to give this a try. BEST DECISION EVER. He probably doesn’t agree but I think he finally know what it’s like to feel full now. He struggles to get the last few bits out but he eventually gets it. He’s been trying to flip it over with no success yet. The rubber part on the bottom really helps with that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for a huskie with an agile tongue
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is made well, sturdy, are easy to wash. We bought several different bowls to compair. This was the least favorite. The little mounds weren't tall enough to give my huskie much of a challenge. Also, the rubber treads on the bottom weren't very useful. She ate as it slide across the floor. This may be better suited for a smaller dog.
customer_reviews.author: Spam Yee

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This bowl worked well to help reduce the speed at which my dog eats. It’s very easy to clean! I do recommend putting on top of a rug or surface that will help the grips underneath keep it in place. I initially had it on a placemat but it slid all around while she was eating. I got tired of putting it back in its place twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Fun to watch
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our very large MC mix that had bulked up. Voodoo doesn't slow down at all for the ridges lol. She will occasionally sit up and use both paws like an otter now when the kibble level is low, though, so that's fun. But it's hard to turn over, so no kitty tantrums. Easy to clean, so no human tantrums.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pug miracle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my new Pug puppy. Pugs are the most food driven dogs, they inhale their food. After horking the meal down she coughs, gags, pukes and eventually farts. None of this any longer. It takes her 25-30 minutes to eat 1/4 cup of dry dog food. Love this bowl! Thank you Pug mother of many
customer_reviews.author: SheenaZM

customer_reviews.title: Did its job wonderfully, would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I am super happy with my purchase. We took it out of the package, washed it, then tried it out with my young puppy. It did its job wonderfully. My pup, who usually finishes all of his food in about a minute took about 5 minutes to finish. His tail was wagging the whole time and loved having to get each kibble out of the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Pericles

customer_reviews.title: Overall a decent bowl ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent bowl but it slips around while my dog is eating. I had to put a sticky mat under it. *Update* I have to say that the customer service with this seller is fantastic! They contacted me in regards to my issues with the bowl. I wouldn't hesitate to buy any of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Dog Hates, Owner Loves
customer_reviews.text: My dog hates this but that's just because he enjoys eating his food in 5 seconds. Now it takes him at least 6 minutes to finish his bowl. Holds 1/2 a cup of food decently, can probably hold 1 full cup but nothing higher than that. My dog has a small snout so it took him a minute to get used to it but he eventually found a way
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: It does what it claims!
customer_reviews.text: Primary assessment was based on my terrier who normally wolfs down his food. Typically he cleans out his bowl in 30-45 seconds. I now give him his kibble in the slow feeder while I prep his wet food and 'additives'. Total meal time now runs about 5 minutes. Second advantage was that despite extensive training, he is wildly impatient while I fix his meals. Now his kibble is ready instantly and while he munches I can do the rest in a calm environment. Very pleased with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped my cat stop vomiting
customer_reviews.text: My cat had been vomiting a handful of times a month and I needed a way to control the pace he was eating at. He was eating way too fast and puking right after. This slow feeder has done wonders for my cat and his vomited has been reduced substantially. It also seems more fun for him to try and get the food out from the bottom versus just regular old fashion eating out of a bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Timelapse of pup slowly enjoying food
customer_reviews.text: Our pup was a lean mean eating machine. He’d constantly have the hiccups for eating his food in under a minute. We bought this bowl to hopefully slow him down and boy did it work. We are anywhere from 5-9 minutes slower in finishing his meal. Hiccups have reduced. I’ve attached a timelapse and even then there was a handful of kibbles. I recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Really helped our little dog
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 yr.old Millie (long haired chihuahua) eats her entire meal in 15 seconds....not good for her! With this terrific dish, it took her at least 90 seconds...what a difference! It's healthier for her and more pleasant than gulping her food!
customer_reviews.author: camillawk

customer_reviews.title: Your dog needs a tiny nose
customer_reviews.text: This one might work well for a dog with a petite nose, but not for my English Setter. He was unable to get any kibble, got frustrated and attacked the bowl until he managed to flip it. I ended up trying the Slodog feeder by Hyperpet which has worked perfectly and he has not tried to flip it. The Jasgood bowl is well made, just did not work for my beast.
customer_reviews.author: dogplumber

customer_reviews.title: Good slow feeder
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works to slow down my puppy's eating. She doesn't get the hiccups anymore. A better non-slip bottom would significantly improve the product... but the bowl sliding makes it that much more difficult for her to eat, so it helps slow her down more also.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Heaton

customer_reviews.title: Helped slowed down my 10 week old puppy’s eating
customer_reviews.text: It definitely slowed down my puppy’s eating. She would swallow her food down in less than a minute. Now it takes her about 5 minutes to eat and we have less belly issues. I do wish there was more rubber in the bottom so prepare for your dogs bowl to be in the other side of the room lol
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: It works at slowing my dog down a little bit. I think the only “problem” I had with it is that it slides around (not the heaviest/durable feeling material) but I think the sliding actually helped slow my dog’s eating down more so it was a benefit. I can’t say much for durability other than it doesn’t feel super sturdy material, feels like light plastic, but great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work good for French bulldogs
customer_reviews.text: Taking a couple stars off because I think that it should indicate that this product is not for all breeds it did not work out for my French bulldog has his snout is very Large compared to other dogs that might be able to use this
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: He’s gotten better with not attacking the bowl as soon as I ...
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted a rescue pup who is food aggressive. This is a big help in slowing down his eating. I feed him gradually by adding a little food at a time till he’s done with it all. He’s gotten better with not attacking the bowl as soon as I try to put it down for him. He still tries to inhale the food but it’s more of a challenge and does start to eat slower. I’ve never had a food aggressive pet before so I’m very glad there are bowls like this to help control this sort of problem.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Hanscome

customer_reviews.title: Love these bowls!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two super fast eaters. Both from the shelter. A Chinese crested and a boxer, pug, beagle mix(I think). They have had issues with eating since the beginning. Too fast, throw up, eat again. Super gross and not good for the doggos. These bowls were just delivered this afternoon and dinner time was amazing! They ate their food at a pretty normal speed (still a bit fast if you ask a human eating), but there was no indigestion and no throwing up!! I'm impressed, 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that it worked so well to slow my Labradors eating. My only complaint is that it's a little hard to clean & to dry. But, I guess that's to be expected, or it wouldn't work in slowing down my dogs eating.
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My dog is kind of an obsessive chewer so I was worried this wouldn't hold up. He tends to gnaw on the bowl after he's done eating, and it's held up really well so far. I'd definitely get another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AnonyMouse Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product just not for snub nosed dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bowl. Good for medium size dogs. The color is vibrant. The material is durable. However, it’s not that useful for snub nosed dogs. I read reviews that it would work for French bulldogs from another person but it wasn’t the case for us.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Helps slow eating some.
customer_reviews.text: My dog inhales food within seconds. This slowed her down a lot the first time I used it. She seemed to figure out how to eat it a little faster after the first use. It helps a little. I'm sure it varies for each dog and the size and shape of their snout.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Slows Down Fast Eater!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Has definitely slowed down the gulping of my Olde English Bulldog puppy. Easy to clean and so far durable.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Tramonti

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: This works ammmazzziinnngg. I noticed my 2 month old puppy since the day we got her would finish her bowl in 0.2 seconds flat. So we ordered this to slow her down. And it’s amazing because this will take a good 5 min. more if I’m lucky, for her to finish her food. Which means 5+ min. I have of not worrying about what she’s doing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a rat terrier I was trying to slow down gulping his food up. The quality is there but the picture showed a puppy so I thought it would be fine. Just way to big I had to return it. If you have a medium size dog this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: stacy kessler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for gobbler!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a very quick eater and obsessed with food. He will gobble his food in seconds and has gotten sick because of eating too fast. He even has problems during the night because of eating too fast. My wife has tried to come up with countless ways of slowing him down. She came across this and decided to try it out. It works...it really works!!!
customer_reviews.author: KjandKt

product_meta.title: JASGOOD Dog Feeder Slow Eating Pet Bowl Eco-Friendly Durable Non-Toxic Preventing Choking Healthy Design Bowl for Dog Pet Slow Feeder
feature_bullets: ★Warm tip:This is NOT a CAT bowl !★The slow feeder dog bowl is better for puppy and Medium dogs.Large dog slow feeder via the link:https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07VVKWXXY?ref=myi_title_dp

Size: Bowl diameter 18cm(7.1Inch). Bowl bottom diameter 19.6cm(7.7Inch).High 4.5cm/(1.7Inch). Bowl Net weight:186g. This is also a great Diet Bowl. The unique design makes any amount of food go further and so the dog feels full on a smaller amount of food. Suitable for wet or dry food; Great solution for dogs who eat and drink quickly.The dog slow feeder bowl is made of food-safe,hig-strength PP materials,and is BPA,Phthalate free.
Features: Source of the design of nature, imitating the wild dogs foraging process environment, every meal will turn into a dog healthy and happy games.

The slow feeding bowl is carefully designed to slow down feeding that encourages pet to eat or drink at a slower pace preventing indigestion, vomiting and bloating. Help control canine obesity with the a maze in a bowl and a calory controlled diet. Eating slower is healthier for your dog.
Easy to clean & Top-rack dishwasher safe.This slow bowl can holds about 1.5 cups(about 9 oz) of dry dog food.
